results.title: Raygun's nightmare
results.creator_credit: Peter Wallach, David Jablin, Atlantic Television and Imagination Productions
results.brief_description: An animated satire combining a mixture of live, puppets and computer animation, on American politics in which President Raygun has a terrible nightmare about the invasion of America by a huge Japanese electronic monster. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Wallach, David Jablin, Atlantic Television and Imagination Productions

results.title: Raving waving
results.creator_credit: Stuart Wynn Jones and Grasshopper Group
results.brief_description: An experiment in animation technique produced by a group of amateur filmmakers. Abstract wave movements are animated in time with rhythmic “musique concrete”, the sound track of which was edited note by note on tape.
results.description: An experiment in animation technique produced by a group of amateur filmmakers. Abstract wave movements are animated in time with rhythmic “musique concrete”, the sound track of which was edited note by note on tape.

results.title: Rats of Tobruk
results.brief_description: The upcoming film from Phillip Noyce is ‘a story of how a diverse bunch of Aussie blokes – including a farmer, a schoolteacher, an Indigenous Australian boxing champ and a former safe breaker - helped turn the course of history – setting their courage, camaraderie and ingenuity against the German “blitzkrieg”.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

results.description: The upcoming film from director Phillip Noyce is ‘a story of how a diverse bunch of Aussie blokes – including a farmer, a schoolteacher, an Indigenous Australian boxing champ and a former safe breaker - helped turn the course of history – setting their courage, camaraderie and ingenuity against the German “blitzkrieg”, comprising dive-bombers, Panzer tanks and battle-hardened infantry.’ The film is based on Noyce’s father’s wartime diaries.
description_for_label: The upcoming film from director Phillip Noyce is ‘a story of how a diverse bunch of Aussie blokes – including a farmer, a schoolteacher, an Indigenous Australian boxing champ and a former safe breaker - helped turn the course of history – setting their courage, camaraderie and ingenuity against the German “blitzkrieg”, comprising dive-bombers, Panzer tanks and battle-hardened infantry.’ The film is based on Noyce’s father’s wartime diaries.

results.title: Rat and rat tat
results.creator_credit: Ray Cowling, Ken Turnbull and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A play on the phonic, graphic and semantic relationships of words, designed for children who have already learned basic phonic-graphic correspondences. Includes several methods of blending in the movements of the animated letters. Suitable for upper primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Cowling, Ken Turnbull and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: Rarotonga
results.brief_description: A look at the people and places of Rarotonga, the biggest island in the Cook Islands. No narration.

results.title: Rarg (K)
results.creator_credit: Tony Collingwood, Christopher O'Hare and Tony Collingwood Productions
results.brief_description: This is the true story of Rarg, a land so perfect that the sun never rose until it was absolutely sure everyone was awake. Everybody in Rarg was happy, until, one day, they discovered they were just a dream in the mind of a man called Edwin Barnes. To save the land of Rarg, they must stop Edwin Barnes waking up. Written by Tony Collingwood. Cast includes Nigel Hawthorne as the storyteller.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Collingwood, Christopher O’Hare and Tony Collingwood Productions

results.title: Rapunzel in suburbia
results.brief_description: This film offers a unique opportunity to discover the personality and style of one of Australia’s most prominent authors. Dorothy Hewitt thoroughly engages her audience with stories of her life, comments on her philosophy and discussion of her major works.
results.description: This film offers a unique opportunity to discover the personality and style of one of Australia’s most prominent authors. Dorothy Hewitt thoroughly engages her audience with stories of her life, comments on her philosophy and discussion of her major works.

results.title: Rapid transit
results.brief_description: Forms of rapid transit are vital links in a balanced transportation system. The variety of existing systems in use in the United States and in Toronto, Canada, are shown and the film then goes on to forecast the forms of the new rapid transit facilities soon to become available for use in big cities.

results.title: Range sheep
results.brief_description: Shows the feeding of orphan lambs from bottles, and the shearing, marking, counting, and pasturing of sheep in the summer. Points out that some fo the sheep are marketed in the fall, while the rest of the flock is cared for in the winter.

results.title: Random events
results.creator_credit: John Friedman, Kevin Smith, Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description: Patterson Hume and Donald Ivey demonstrate how the overall effect of a large number of random events can be predicted statistically, and apply the results to the predicability of radioactive decay.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Friedman, Kevin Smith, Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
